body:
## What happened

I was hot reloading when the instance is currently loaded/running. 
The changes propagates to a different files and it does'nt reflect back from where it is called.
If I change the code of a file which contains the Scaffold it works fine.
If I change the code of a file which doesn't contains the Scaffold. Say for example a StatelessWidget which is inside a scaffold but resides in a different file.
And So hot reload is rejected.

## Update
So even if the file contains scaffold and code changes both, the hot reload is rejected.

## Version information

Android Studio `3.1.3` • Flutter plugin `io.flutter 26.0.1` • Dart plugin `173.4700`

## Flutter Doctor
```
"C: lutter master lutter in lutter.bat" --no-color doctor
Doctor summary (to see all details, run flutter doctor -v):
[√] Flutter (Channel dev, v0.5.7, on Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.17134.191], locale en-US)
[√] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK 27.0.3)
[√] Android Studio (version 3.1)
[√] IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition (version 2018.1)
[√] Connected devices (1 available)

• No issues found!
Process finished with exit code 0
```

*** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***

Revision: '5'
ABI: 'arm'

Lost connection to device.

Unhandled exception:

comment_data.body: Oops, duplicate issue. See this for more info https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/19517
